intro: Collinsia sparsiflora var. arvensis, commonly known as the field flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. This variety is distinguished by its more open growth habit and fewer flowers compared to the typical form of Collinsia sparsiflora.
